Class gameController

java.lang.Object
Controller.gameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class gameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    gameController​(Vue.GameView view)
    This is the class constructor which initializes the view and the model (Partie object)

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    Receives action events (click on button, select a check box etc) and react
    void addPlayer​(java.lang.String username, boolean isBot)
    Create a new player based on informations given by user, then add the player into list of players
    void changeFrame​(javax.swing.JPanel jPan)
    Factorises lines of codes that charges java container to the view
    int getIndexNextPlayer()
    Returns index of next player that will take the round
    Index is sent to view to show the player's interface (name, cards, etc)
    int getIndexPreviousPlayer()
    Returns index of previous player, useful to find out who has accused the current player therefore the current player could take action upon the accuser
    Index is sent to view to show the player's interface (name, cards, etc)
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getListsOfPlayersToAccuse​(int index)
    Returns a list of players that i can accuse (excluding myself)
    Modele.JoueurAbs getPlayer​(int index)
    Returns a Joueur object based on a given index
    Allows view to retrieve informations from model on selected player
    javax.swing.JPanel getYourCards​(int index)
    Returns a java container containing the list of cards in hand of a selected player
    This container will be charged by view to show the current player his cards
    javax.swing.JPanel resolveHunt​(Modele.Carte c)
    Resolve the hunt effect of cards
    Returns appropriate java container based on the selected card
    For example, asking next player to play, reveal identity, choose a card, etc
    javax.swing.JPanel resolveWitch​(Modele.Carte c)
    Resolve the witch effect of cards
    Returns appropriate java container based on the selected card
    For example, asking next player to play, reveal identity, choose a card, etc
    javax.swing.JPanel revealIdentity()
    Returns a java container containing the result of a reveal, such as player's identity and personalized message
    Calls the function in model to determine the effect of this reveal,for example, to add score or to choose next player
    javax.swing.JPanel revealMyIdentity()
    Returns a java container containing the result of my own reveal
    Calls the function in model to determine the effect of this reveal
    For example, to add score or to choose next player
    void startGame()
    Initializes the game by asking number of players and distributing cards accordingly

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Initializes the game by asking number of players and distributing cards accordingly

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String username, boolean isBot)
      Create a new player based on informations given by user, then add the player into list of players
      Parameters:
      username - a name keyed in by user
      isBot - a boolean to create virtual player if the value is true

    • getPlayer

      public Modele.JoueurAbs getPlayer​(int index)
      Returns a Joueur object based on a given index
      Allows view to retrieve informations from model on selected player
      Parameters:
      index - a numeric value which indicates which player is selected
      Returns:
      JoueurAbs a Joueur object

    • getYourCards

      public javax.swing.JPanel getYourCards​(int index)
      Returns a java container containing the list of cards in hand of a selected player
      This container will be charged by view to show the current player his cards
      Parameters:
      index - a numeric value which indicates which player is selected
      Returns:
      JPanel a Java container containing lists of cards

    • revealIdentity

      public javax.swing.JPanel revealIdentity()
      Returns a java container containing the result of a reveal, such as player's identity and personalized message
      Calls the function in model to determine the effect of this reveal,for example, to add score or to choose next player
      Returns:
      JPanel a Java container containing the result of a reveal

    • revealMyIdentity

      public javax.swing.JPanel revealMyIdentity()
      Returns a java container containing the result of my own reveal
      Calls the function in model to determine the effect of this reveal
      For example, to add score or to choose next player
      Returns:
      JPanel a Java container containing the result of my own reveal

    • getListsOfPlayersToAccuse

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getListsOfPlayersToAccuse​(int index)
      Returns a list of players that i can accuse (excluding myself)
      Parameters:
      index - my index so that i can be removed from the list
      Returns:
      ArrayList names of players that i can accuse

    • getIndexNextPlayer

      public int getIndexNextPlayer()
      Returns index of next player that will take the round
      Index is sent to view to show the player's interface (name, cards, etc)
      Returns:
      integer index of next player

    • getIndexPreviousPlayer

      public int getIndexPreviousPlayer()
      Returns index of previous player, useful to find out who has accused the current player therefore the current player could take action upon the accuser
      Index is sent to view to show the player's interface (name, cards, etc)
      Returns:
      integer index of previous player

      public void changeFrame​(javax.swing.JPanel jPan)
      Factorises lines of codes that charges java container to the view
      Parameters:
      jPan - a container that will be charged by the main frame

    • resolveHunt

      public javax.swing.JPanel resolveHunt​(Modele.Carte c)
      Resolve the hunt effect of cards
      Returns appropriate java container based on the selected card
      For example, asking next player to play, reveal identity, choose a card, etc
      Parameters:
      c - a card picked by player
      Returns:
      JPanel a Java container containing the result of my own reveal
